name: Patient Additional Demographic
description: The Patient Additional Demographic segment (PD1) contains demographic information that is likely to change about the patient. This segment is particularly important for ADT (Admit, Discharge, Transfer) workflows and includes information such as primary care provider, patient primary facility, student indicator, handicap, living will status, organ donor status, separate bill, duplicate patient indicator, and publicity code. The PD1 segment supplements the basic demographic information provided in the PID segment with additional healthcare-specific demographic details.

cardinality.note: Optional segment providing additional patient demographics beyond PID

PD1.1.name: Living Dependency
PD1.1.description: This field contains a code defining the living dependency of the patient (e.g., spouse dependent, medical supervision required, small children dependent).
PD1.1.generationHint: Use N (not applicable) for most cases, SP for married patients with dependent spouse

PD1.2.name: Living Arrangement
PD1.2.description: This field contains a code defining the living arrangement of the patient (e.g., alone, family, institution, relative, spouse only).
PD1.2.generationHint: F (family) most common, A (alone) for elderly, I (institution) for nursing homes

PD1.3.name: Patient Primary Facility
PD1.3.description: This field contains the patient's primary healthcare facility. This is useful when a patient is seen at multiple facilities within a healthcare system.
PD1.3.generationHint: Primary care clinic or main hospital where patient receives most care

PD1.4.name: Patient Primary Care Provider Name & ID No.
PD1.4.description: This field contains the patient's primary care provider. This is the healthcare provider responsible for the overall care of the patient.
PD1.4.generationHint: Family medicine physician, internist, or pediatrician serving as PCP

PD1.5.name: Student Indicator
PD1.5.description: This field indicates whether the patient is a student. This information can be important for billing and insurance purposes.
PD1.5.generationHint: N for most patients, F for college-age patients, P for adult learners

PD1.6.name: Handicap
PD1.6.description: This field indicates the patient's handicap status or disability. This information is important for care planning and facility accommodations.
PD1.6.generationHint: N for most patients, Y for patients requiring accessibility accommodations

PD1.7.name: Living Will Code
PD1.7.description: This field indicates whether the patient has a living will and the status of that living will.
PD1.7.generationHint: U for most patients, Y for elderly patients, N with specific documentation

PD1.8.name: Organ Donor Code
PD1.8.description: This field indicates whether the patient is an organ donor.
PD1.8.generationHint: U for most cases, Y for younger adult patients, N for patients with religious restrictions

PD1.9.name: Separate Bill
PD1.9.description: This field indicates whether the patient should receive a separate bill for services.
PD1.9.generationHint: N for most patients, Y for patients with special billing arrangements

PD1.10.name: Duplicate Patient
PD1.10.description: This field indicates whether this patient record is a duplicate of another patient record in the system.
PD1.10.generationHint: Usually empty unless patient record consolidation is needed

PD1.11.name: Publicity Code
PD1.11.description: This field contains a user-defined code to indicate what level of publicity is allowed (e.g., No Publicity, Family Only).
PD1.11.generationHint: F for most patients, N for high-profile patients or sensitive cases

PD1.12.name: Protection Indicator
PD1.12.description: This field indicates whether the patient is in a protection program (e.g., witness protection).
PD1.12.generationHint: N for virtually all patients, Y only for special protection cases

notes: PD1 segment is optional but provides valuable supplemental patient information
Primary care provider information (PD1.4) is crucial for care coordination
Living will and organ donor status (PD1.7, PD1.8) are important for end-of-life planning
Student indicator (PD1.5) affects insurance and billing processing
Handicap information (PD1.6) is essential for facility planning and accommodations
Publicity code (PD1.11) is important for patient privacy and media relations

dataConsistency.livingArrangement: Should align with patient age and social situation
dataConsistency.studentStatus: Should align with patient age (typically 16-30 for active students)
dataConsistency.primaryCareProvider: Should be active provider with appropriate specialty
dataConsistency.livingWill: More common in patients over 65 or with serious medical conditions

businessRules.primaryFacility: Should match the healthcare system where PCP practices
businessRules.organDonor: May have religious or cultural constraints
businessRules.protectionIndicator: Requires special security protocols when Y
businessRules.publicityCode: Affects visitor policies and information sharing
businessRules.separateBill: Requires coordination with billing and insurance systems

messageFlow.workflow: Typically follows PID segment in ADT messages for comprehensive patient demographics
